title: Mega corn mill in Lane Cove on the market
text:
Food company Ingredion has listed its three-hectare corn mill in Lane Cove in Sydney's northern suburbs for sale, capitalising on renewed housing developer appetites and surrounding high density development.

The offer comes as the NSW government announced the sale of two more large development sites at Lachlan's Line, near North Ryde station, about 2 kilometres away.

Ingredion has put its Lane Cove River site up for sale.

The attractiveness of the sites is boosted by the North West Metro Line, a railway line that currently connects Tallawong in Sydney's north-west with Chatswood, and will eventually connect to the City and South West Lines.

The new line has encouraged not only more land releases but unlocked development potential for many areas through rezoning plans.

The site at 170 Epping Road, on the shores of the Lane Cove River, has mixed use development potential.
description: The move to sell the 3-hectare site follows the NSW government's sale of two more mega development sites at nearby Lachlan's Line.
